text: South Korean girl group I.O.I released two extended plays, two single albums and six singles. Formed in 2016 through the survival show Produce 101, I.O.I debuted in May 2016 with the release of their first EP Chrysalis. They disbanded in January 2017. ==Extended plays== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of extended plays, with selected chart positions and sales ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:6em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Details ! scope="col" colspan="2"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Sales |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;"|KOR Gaon Weekly Album Chart * * ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;"|US World |- ! scope="row" | Chrysalis | * Released: May 4, 2016 * Label: YMC Entertainment * Formats: CD, digital download | 4 || — | * KOR: 87,026Cumulative sales for Chrysalis: * * * * JPN: 303 * US: 1,000 |- ! scope="row" | Miss Me? | * Released: October 17, 2016 * Label: YMC Entertainment * Formats: CD, digital download | 2 || 11 | * KOR: 106,439Cumulative sales for Miss Me?: * * * * JPN: 1,322 |- | colspan="7" style="font-size:8pt;"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart or were not released in that region. |} ==Singles== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of singles, with selected chart positions, showing year released and album name ! scope="col" rowspan="3" style="width:14em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="3" | Year ! scope="col" colspan="5" | Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="3" | Sales ! scope="col" rowspan="3" style="width:8em;"| Album |- ! style="width:3em;font- size:90%" colspan="3" | KOR ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;" rowspan="2" |JPN Hot ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;" rowspan="2" |US World |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;"|Digital Gaon Weekly Digital Chart * * * * * * ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font- size:90%;" |Album Gaon Weekly Album Chart * * ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;" |Hot Kpop Hot 100: * The Kpop Hot 100 was discontinued beginning with the July 16, 2014 issue date.
